intro: Hillia prasiantha, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Hillia prasiantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
